msContents.summary: A 15th-century palm-leaf manuscript of the Cāndravyākaraṇa by the Buddhist grammarian Candragomin, containing the sūtrapāṭha without any commentary. The initial folios are missing, and the surviving portion begins with what looks like the end of Cāndravyākaraṇa 1.4.12 (vido laṭo vā) in a slight modified form (the particle vā is missing); sūtras 13 and 14 as they are found in the printed editions are omitted, and the first complete sūtra is 1.4.15. The manuscript contains all six sections (adhyāyas) of Candragomin's grammar. One remarkable feature is its almost generalised use of a sign for the avagraha marking the elision of an initial short "a" in certain sandhi phenomena.

msItem.title: Cāndravyākaraṇa

msItem.colophon: [44r5] śreyo ’stu || samvat_ 532 āṣāḍha kṛṣṇa || ekādaśyā tithau | kṛrttika ghaṭi 20 rohiṇīnakṣatre || gaṇḍaghaṭi 9 vṛddhiyoge || somavāsare | likhitam idaṃ || @ ||

supportDesc.foliation: Nepālākṣarā letter numerals, mid-left margin, verso.
supportDesc.condition: Incomplete (ff. 1-7, 26-27 and 30 are missing), generally in good condition. One of the left corners of ff. 12-33 has been torn off, with occasional loss of a few akṣaras, and restored with translucid paper.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 52 akṣaras per line.
layout.stringHole: One string hole, to the left of the centre, placed inside an approximately 3 cm-wide blank space, framed above and below by the uninterrupted top and bottom lines of the text.
layout.p: The end of sections is generally marked by a double daṇḍa followed by either a simple circle or a more elaborate puṣpikā and another double daṇḍa.

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1873-6.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
